claim: Sharks cannot swim backwards at all.
correction: Most sharks cannot swim tail-first but can maneuver slightly backward with body movements.

claim: Mountains form only from volcanoes.
correction: Many mountains form from tectonic uplift and folding, not just volcanism.

claim: Earth is closer to the Sun in summer worldwide.
correction: The Northern Hemisphere’s summer occurs when Earth is farther from the Sun; seasons depend on tilt.

claim: Drinking hot liquids kills viruses in the throat.
correction: Hot drinks may soothe but do not kill viruses in the body.

claim: Colorless chemicals are always harmless.
correction: Toxic chemicals can be colorless; safety depends on properties, not color.

claim: All comets come from the asteroid belt.
correction: Comets originate mainly from the Kuiper Belt and Oort Cloud.

claim: Every meteor that hits Earth becomes a meteorite visible on the ground.
correction: Most meteors burn up; only some fragments reach the surface as meteorites.

claim: Cloud seeding always guarantees rain.
correction: Cloud seeding can influence precipitation under specific conditions but doesn’t ensure rain.

claim: The Pacific Ocean is always deeper than the Atlantic at every point.
correction: The Pacific has deeper trenches, but depth varies; some Atlantic spots exceed many Pacific areas.

claim: Only snakes shed skin.
correction: Many animals shed skin, including lizards, insects, and humans continually.

claim: A person’s hair turns white overnight from shock.
correction: Hair color changes gradually; sudden whitening is not supported biologically.

claim: Mercury thermometers are still the standard in all hospitals.
correction: Most healthcare uses digital or alcohol thermometers; mercury types are being phased out.

claim: Eating bread makes glue in your stomach.
correction: Digestion breaks down bread; no glue forms.

claim: All iguanas are green.
correction: Iguanas come in various colors, including blue, orange, and red hues.

claim: Humans cannot survive more than three days without water under any circumstance.
correction: Survival time varies with conditions; some have survived longer or less depending on environment.

claim: All citrus fruits come from Asia originally.
correction: Many citrus species originated in Southeast Asia, but some relatives arose elsewhere.

claim: Antibiotics in meat remain active in cooked food.
correction: Cooking degrades residual antibiotics; regulations limit residues.

claim: If you cut a flatworm, both halves always regenerate into full worms of equal size.
correction: Regeneration depends on species and cut location; outcomes vary.

claim: Cats purr only when happy.
correction: Cats also purr when stressed, in pain, or healing.

claim: Rainforests always have poor visibility because of constant rain.
correction: Rainforests vary; rain is episodic, not constant.

claim: Only humans use tools.
correction: Many animals, including primates, birds, and dolphins, use tools.

claim: Oxygen therapy is always harmless.
correction: Excess oxygen can be harmful; therapy requires proper dosing.

claim: The speed of light is constant in all materials.
correction: Light slows in media relative to vacuum; its vacuum speed is constant.

claim: All deserts are expanding rapidly due to climate change alone.
correction: Some deserts expand while others shrink; land use and climate both affect boundaries.

claim: Space has a universal up and down.
correction: In microgravity, orientation is relative; there is no universal up or down.

claim: Electric eels are true eels.
correction: Electric eels are knifefish, not true eels.

claim: Only female mosquitoes bite humans.
correction: Female mosquitoes bite for blood; males typically feed on nectar.

claim: All marine mammals have blubber of the same thickness.
correction: Blubber thickness varies by species, age, and environment.

claim: Egyptian hieroglyphs were the first writing system.
correction: Other early scripts like Sumerian cuneiform predate or are contemporaneous.

claim: Birds don’t have a sense of smell.
correction: Many birds have well-developed olfaction.

claim: The Milky Way is the largest galaxy in the universe.
correction: Many galaxies, such as Andromeda and giant ellipticals, are larger.

claim: Only male lions hunt.
correction: Lionesses perform most hunts; males also hunt when needed.

claim: All frogs live mostly in water.
correction: Many frog species spend significant time on land; some are arboreal or desert-adapted.

claim: Time passes more slowly on mountaintops than at sea level.
correction: Time runs slightly faster at higher altitude due to weaker gravity.

claim: The color of smoke always indicates fuel type only.
correction: Smoke color depends on temperature, fuel, and combustion completeness.

claim: Coral reefs are made of plants.
correction: Reefs are built by animals (coral polyps) with symbiotic algae.

claim: All alcohol evaporates from food during cooking.
correction: Cooking reduces but may not remove all alcohol depending on time and method.

claim: Whales breathe through their mouths underwater.
correction: Whales breathe air through blowholes at the surface.

claim: All lakes are fresh water.
correction: Some lakes, like the Great Salt Lake, are saline.

claim: Red sky at night always means good weather the next day worldwide.
correction: The saying works regionally; weather depends on many factors.

claim: All amphibians must stay moist constantly.
correction: Some amphibians tolerate drier conditions and have protective adaptations.

claim: Coins are always made of pure metal listed on them.
correction: Most coins are alloys or plated for durability and cost.

claim: Ultrasound can shatter kidney stones inside the body instantly without side effects.
correction: Lithotripsy can fragment stones but may cause pain, bruising, or complications.

claim: All bacteria die in a standard freezer.
correction: Freezing can inactivate some bacteria but many survive and revive when thawed.

claim: Crocodiles cry to lure prey.
correction: Tear secretion in crocodiles is unrelated to luring prey.

claim: Mars has liquid water oceans today.
correction: No liquid surface oceans exist; water is locked as ice or vapor.

claim: Only Earth has plate tectonics.
correction: Evidence suggests possible tectonic-like activity on bodies like Europa and ancient Mars.

claim: An airplane door can be opened mid-flight by a passenger.
correction: Cabin pressure and door mechanisms prevent opening at cruising altitude.

claim: All seeds need light to germinate.
correction: Many seeds germinate best in darkness; requirements vary by species.

claim: A diamond test with glass is conclusive.
correction: Scratching glass is not a definitive diamond test; other materials can do it.

claim: You lose most body heat through your head.
correction: Heat loss depends on exposed area; any uncovered part loses heat similarly.

claim: Chocolate is deadly to all animals equally.
correction: Toxicity varies; dogs are sensitive, some animals tolerate more, others less.

claim: Spacecraft rely on air to push against for thrust.
correction: Spacecraft use reaction mass expelled for thrust; no air is needed.

claim: Sunburn is not possible in winter.
correction: UV exposure can cause sunburn in any season, especially at altitude or on snow.

claim: All sound needs a physical medium; radio proves otherwise.
correction: Radio waves are electromagnetic, not sound; sound does require a medium.

claim: Camels are native to only the Middle East.
correction: Camels are native to parts of Asia and Africa; related camelids are native to South America.

claim: All salt is made of sodium chloride only.
correction: Salts are a broad class of compounds; table salt is sodium chloride.

claim: Globally, winter occurs at the same time everywhere.
correction: Seasons are opposite between hemispheres.

claim: All bees make honey.
correction: Only some species, like honeybees, produce significant honey.

claim: Tennis balls were always yellow historically.
correction: Tennis balls were originally white; yellow became standard for visibility.

claim: Polar ice caps are pure white because ice is colorless.
correction: Ice can appear blue; white comes from air bubbles scattering light.

claim: Paper cuts bleed less because paper is sterile.
correction: Paper isn’t sterile; the shallow cut and vessel size limit bleeding.

claim: Crystals grow only in caves over millions of years.
correction: Crystals can form in labs or nature over varied timescales, from minutes to eons.

claim: All mountains stop growing once formed.
correction: Mountains can still uplift or erode depending on tectonics and climate.

claim: Hand sanitizer works better the more you use it consecutively.
correction: Effectiveness depends on proper single use and contact time; overuse doesn’t amplify results.

claim: All lightning bolts strike from cloud to ground.
correction: Lightning can be cloud-to-cloud, intra-cloud, or ground-to-cloud.

claim: The North Pole has penguins and polar bears together.
correction: Polar bears live in the Arctic; penguins live in the Southern Hemisphere.

claim: You can’t get dehydrated in humid climates.
correction: High humidity can still lead to dehydration, especially with sweating.

claim: Humans cannot taste water.
correction: Humans can perceive taste qualities of water, especially impurities.

claim: All bats hibernate.
correction: Some bat species migrate or remain active depending on climate.

claim: Every rainbow needs rain.
correction: Rainbows form from water droplets; mist or spray can create them without rain.

claim: Gold cannot rust or tarnish in any environment.
correction: Gold is highly resistant but can tarnish slightly in some chemical conditions or alloys.

claim: The vacuum of space sucks objects out of spacecraft violently when a door opens.
correction: Pressure equalizes rapidly, but objects move due to pressure differential, not suction force.

claim: All planets rotate counterclockwise when viewed from above the North Pole.
correction: Venus and Uranus rotate retrograde compared to most planets.

claim: Spiders create identical webs every time.
correction: Web design varies with species, environment, and damage.

claim: You cannot start a fire with ice.
correction: Clear ice lenses can focus sunlight enough to start a fire under ideal conditions.

claim: Every snake injects venom through hollow fangs.
correction: Many snakes are nonvenomous; some venomous species have grooved fangs.

claim: Earth’s atmosphere is mostly carbon dioxide.
correction: Nitrogen and oxygen dominate; CO2 is a trace gas.

claim: Lightning never strikes the same cloud twice.
correction: Cloud regions can be struck repeatedly during a storm.

claim: The Great Barrier Reef is a single coral colony.
correction: It is a vast system of thousands of reefs and islands.

claim: All birds build nests in trees.
correction: Birds nest in varied places: ground, cliffs, burrows, buildings.

claim: Every star we see is part of the Milky Way except the Sun.
correction: All naked-eye stars are in the Milky Way; other galaxies appear as diffuse objects.

claim: Moonlight is sunlight cooled by space.
correction: Moonlight is sunlight reflected off the lunar surface without cooling into visible light.

claim: Frogs breathe only through skin underwater.
correction: Frogs use skin, lungs, and mouth lining; many breathe through skin in water.

claim: Birds sleep only at night.
correction: Bird sleep patterns vary; some nap by day and fly at night.

claim: Plants grow faster to music because they hear it like animals.
correction: Any effects are due to vibration or environmental factors, not hearing.

claim: A tsunami is just a very big tide.
correction: Tsunamis are seismic or landslide-driven waves, not tides.

claim: Night vision goggles emit harmful radiation to the eyes.
correction: They amplify light or use infrared sensors; emissions are minimal in normal use.

claim: Every hurricane has an eye.
correction: Weak tropical storms may lack a well-defined eye.

claim: All ants bite humans.
correction: Some ants bite, others sting, and many do neither routinely.

claim: Lead pencils contain lead.
correction: Pencils use graphite, not lead.

claim: All rocks sink in water.
correction: Pumice can float due to trapped gas.

claim: All volcanoes are on land.
correction: Most volcanoes lie underwater along mid-ocean ridges and arcs.

claim: Every marine fish drinks seawater continuously.
correction: Many marine fish drink seawater; freshwater fish generally do not.

claim: Auroras occur only near the North Pole.
correction: Auroras occur near both poles (aurora borealis and australis).

claim: Drinking coffee depletes your body’s water completely.
correction: Coffee contributes to hydration; diuretic effect is mild in regular users.

claim: Aluminum foil blocks all radio waves completely.
correction: Foil can attenuate signals but doesn’t guarantee complete blocking without full enclosure.

claim: Earth is the only planet with clouds.
correction: Planets like Venus, Jupiter, Mars, and Titan have clouds.

claim: All geckos can walk on any surface, including Teflon.
correction: Gecko adhesion fails on some very smooth, low-surface-energy materials like Teflon.

claim: The deepest ocean point is the Mariana Trench because of waterfall erosion.
correction: It formed from plate subduction, not waterfall erosion.

claim: Earth’s magnetic field comes from a giant bar magnet inside Earth.
correction: It arises from dynamo action in the liquid outer core.

claim: All glaciers move at the same speed.
correction: Glacier speeds vary widely from centimeters to meters per day.

claim: Women have one more rib than men.
correction: Typical rib counts are the same for men and women.

claim: Polar nights mean absolute darkness all winter.
correction: Polar nights still have twilight and moonlight; not total darkness continuously.

claim: Monsoons are just heavy rains.
correction: Monsoons are seasonal wind shifts that can bring wet or dry periods.

claim: Digital clocks are always more accurate than analog clocks.
correction: Accuracy depends on the timekeeping mechanism, not display type.

claim: Only mammals nurse their young.
correction: Mammals produce milk; some birds feed crop milk, but true nursing is mammalian.

claim: Heat lightning is a special lightning type without thunder.
correction: It is distant lightning; thunder is unheard because of distance.

claim: Every planet has weather.
correction: Not all bodies have atmospheres; without an atmosphere, weather as we know it doesn’t occur.

claim: Lightning is attracted to metal exclusively.
correction: Lightning seeks the path of least resistance, often tall or conductive objects, not metal exclusively.

claim: All caves form from water erosion.
correction: Caves can form from lava tubes, dissolution, wind, or tectonics.

claim: Long hair grows faster than short hair.
correction: Growth rate is determined by follicles, not hair length.

claim: Human teeth are the hardest substance in the body because of bone.
correction: Enamel is the hardest substance; it isn’t bone.

claim: Crows have the smallest bird brains relative to body size.
correction: Crows have large, capable brains relative to body size.

claim: All deserts receive no rain in a year.
correction: Deserts receive little rain; some get occasional precipitation.

claim: If pond water looks clear, it’s free of microbes.
correction: Clear water can still contain microbes.

claim: Every river flows south.
correction: Rivers flow downhill regardless of compass direction.

claim: Penguins are only black and white.
correction: Some penguins have additional colors like yellow or orange markings.

claim: Only humans experience menopause.
correction: Some whales also experience menopause.

claim: All gemstones are minerals.
correction: Amber and jet are organic gems, not minerals.

claim: Blood in veins is blue until oxygenated.
correction: Venous blood is dark red; veins look blue due to light scattering.

claim: Oxygen therapy is safe to self-administer from any source.
correction: Medical oxygen requires prescription and proper administration.

claim: Planets make noise you could hear in space.
correction: Space is a vacuum; sound cannot travel. Planetary emissions are detected as electromagnetic waves.

claim: Every cloud produces precipitation.
correction: Many clouds dissipate without producing rain or snow.

claim: All birds have hollow bones.
correction: Many birds have pneumatic bones, but some bones are solid or partly solid.

claim: Earth’s climate has been stable until recent industry.
correction: Climate has varied naturally; recent rapid warming is strongly linked to human activity.

claim: Owning houseplants always increases indoor oxygen to outdoor levels.
correction: Plants have minimal effect on indoor O2 compared to ventilation.

claim: All starfish can regenerate entire bodies from a single arm.
correction: Regeneration ability varies; not all species or arm fragments can regrow whole bodies.

claim: Radioactivity makes things glow green automatically.
correction: Most radioactive materials do not glow; some produce blue Cherenkov light in water.

claim: All soil is dark brown when healthy.
correction: Soils vary in color depending on minerals, organic content, and moisture.

claim: Ice is always slippery because it is smooth.
correction: A thin melt layer and pressure reduce friction; temperature affects slipperiness.

claim: Every volcano eruption includes lava flow.
correction: Some eruptions are explosive with ash only and little to no lava flows.

claim: Earth’s sky would be black without oceans.
correction: Sky color is due to atmospheric scattering; oceans are not required for blue sky.

claim: All lightning is white.
correction: Lightning color can vary with temperature and particulates.

claim: Ants can live underwater indefinitely.
correction: Some survive floods briefly via air pockets or rafts; they cannot live submerged indefinitely.

claim: Drinking vinegar balances blood pH quickly.
correction: Human blood pH is tightly regulated; vinegar does not meaningfully change it in healthy individuals.

claim: Caffeine removes alcohol from your body faster.
correction: Caffeine may increase alertness but does not speed alcohol metabolism.

claim: Piranhas will strip a cow to the bone in seconds universally.
correction: Feeding frenzies are rare; behavior depends on species and conditions.

claim: The Moon has no gravity.
correction: The Moon has about one-sixth of Earth’s gravity.

claim: Termites eat concrete.
correction: Termites cannot digest concrete; they may tunnel through cracks.

claim: All trees produce oxygen only.
correction: Trees respire and consume oxygen as well; net production depends on growth stage and conditions.

claim: You can always tell direction with moss on trees.
correction: Moss grows where moisture and shade favor it; it’s not a reliable compass.

claim: All maps have north at the top.
correction: Map orientation varies; north-up is a convention.

claim: All storms spin faster at the equator.
correction: Coriolis effect is weakest at the equator; storm rotation is more pronounced away from it.

claim: Blood is blue in veins because it lacks iron.
correction: Blood contains iron; deoxygenated blood is dark red.

claim: Only men can be colorblind.
correction: Colorblindness is more common in men but can occur in women.

claim: Kangaroos cannot walk backward because of knee structure only.
correction: Tail and body design limit backward movement; knees are not the sole reason.

claim: All snow is white.
correction: Snow can appear pink (watermelon snow) or gray with impurities or algae.

claim: Sunflowers always contain sunflower oil naturally in liquid form.
correction: Oil is stored in seeds and must be extracted.

claim: Earth’s oceans are uniformly salty.
correction: Salinity varies by location, depth, and freshwater input or evaporation.
